message:
Dialogue outside parliament? No way: Nasim

 Awami League (AL) presidium member Md Nasim said the much-awaited dialogue with the main opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) couldn’t be held outside the national parliament.
“There is no possibility of holding talks outside the parliament. If there is a discussion, it will be inside the parliament,” said Nasim.
 
This came as he was speaking at a discussion arranged by Sechhashebok League at AL office in Dhaka’s Bangabandhu Avenue Friday.
 
Nasim opined that the Awami League won’t let a situation like 1/11 evolve again. He also called upon the opposition to come to the parliament for talks.
 
“Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina made a call for holding discussion freely. The opposition leader, however, ruled that out by terming it ‘drama’ and ‘mockery’ and issued a 48-hour ultimatum for restoration of caretaker government system. We have to flee the country if we want to discuss caretaker government,” said the AL leader.
 
Speaking of the BNP Chairperson, Nasim said: “Don’t do politics with dead bodies. Bangladeshis don’t believe in politics of dead bodies anymore.”
 
Speaking of Hifazat-e-Islam, the AL leader said: “Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina granted Hifazat permission to hold rally in Dhaka. Begum Khaleda Zia, however, took the chance and used Hifazat workers to turn Dhaka into a city of terror and looting.”
 
“Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina knows how to stay beside people and countrymen with the love and care of a mother. On that day, she showed how to stay beside people when it comes to the country’s interests and people’s welfare,” he added.
